title: Gritty and harsh
review: Gritty and harsh, that's Hesperia for you. A thriller set in the desert, drugs and crime. Great acting, some stunning scenery, a really cool film for an indie production!

title: Raw, dark and very real
review: There's a reality at the center of this film that not everyone may be comfortable with. That's OK. Leave the movie for those of us who can handle a darker reality. The story and twists were great. This isn't a phony Hollywood movie but very much an indie. That's a really good thing.

title: Aggression vs vulnerability
review: I really enjoyed how this movie portrayed the juxtaposition of aggression with vulnerability. There's a nice color pallet that's used in the film to really draw the viewer into the mood and characters emotional state. It's a bold script, filled with grit, and is a wonderful example of fine indie filmmaking.
